content: I am on Ubuntu 22 and have installed Lean according to the documentation. In VS-code, when I issue #eval Lean.versionString, I get "4.3.0". But it still get a warning "Opened folder is not a valid Lean 4 project." I realise I should issue "lake +..." to create a new Lean project. But the documentation does not say anything on how to install "lake". Sorry for asking such an, apparently, basic question.

and have installed Lean according to the documentation

which documentation?
The normal installation method should give you lake at the terminal, does lake work?
to start a new project you use lake new myproject
and then you use "open folder" to open the myproject folder in vscode
Unfortunately, there is no "lake" installed. I am referring to this docu: https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/debian.html
Try to run lake again after running apt remove elan
(and perhaps reinstalling elan using the instructions on the page you posted, which should install elan inside your home directory)
Yes - that worked (after sudo apt remove elan I had to re-install). Thank you so much for your great help!
Eugen Lindorfer has marked this topic as resolved.
